title: X-Files actor David Duchovney joins remake of 1996 film The Craft
text:
This is going to be amazing!

The reboot of The Craft has been in the works for five years – and it could be hitting our screens sooner than we think.

David Duchovny, famous for his role in The X-Files will be joining the cast for the 1996 supernatural horror film re-make – and it’s going to be something very special.

The new version of the film will follow Hannah, a high school outcast who falls into a friendship with three other young women and begins experimenting with witchcraft. They unleash a power that at first seems to solve problems in their lives.

But the girls soon realise that the spells they cast have negative consequences.

Zoe Lister-Jones will write and direct the film which is being put together by Columbia and Blumhouse Productions and will star Gideon Adlon (Blockers), Lovie Simone (Greenleaf), Zoey Luna (Pose), Cailee Spaeny (Bad Times at the El Royale) and Nicholas Galitzine (Chambers).

David Duchovny was famous for his role in The X-Files

Development on a remake of the 1996 hit has been in the works for almost five years now, with Honeymoon director Leigh Janiak originally attached to write and direct the project in 2015 – which was supposed to be a sequel to the original.

However, the project was scrapped after negative reactions from fans and a lack of further interest at the studios.

David Duchovny is well-know for his work as the lead on the long-running Fox sci-fi mystery series The X-Files and the Showtime dramedy Californication, for which he earned Golden Globe wins on both, as well as a recurring role in David Lynch’s acclaimed Twin Peaks and the lead role on the short-lived NBC period crime drama Aquarius.

He has also directed several episodes of both hit shows along with Aquarius And Bones and the 2004 film House Of D, which he wrote and starred in with Robin Williams, Tea Leoni and Frank Langella.
